comment.author: 15161049@N06
comment._content: It would be wonderful and very interesting if his book were re-published.  It must be out of copyright by now.  Maybe publish online?

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
Medal Roll Index Card shows him firstly as 2nd Lt in 6th Dragoon Guards Off: 207 2.
The database of UK Soldiers Killed in the Great War states that he had the MC but this is not shown on his MIC.

In 1911 he was a 21 year old Assistant Manager of Wholesale Stationery living with his widowed mother and 3 of his 8 surviving siblings at 29 Southend Road, Beckenham, Kent.
